chapter.title: Chapter Fourteen
chapter.subtitle: Gunatraya-Vibhagayoga
chapter.description: In the fourteenth chapter, Gunatraya-Vibhagayoga is taught. In this chapter, Lord Krishna describes the nature and effect of the three gunas, sattva, raja and tama.

dedication.meaning: I serve the lotus feet of the fearless one, who gives joy to the devotees

verses.Language:
Shri Bhagwanubach
Parang Bhuy: Prabakshyami Gnananang Gnanamuttammam.
Yajjnatva munoy: sarbe parang siddhimito gata:..1..
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said-Again I will tell you about the best of all knowledges, by knowing which the sages attained Param Siddhi from this material world.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Idang jnanamupasritya mam sadharmyamagata:
2.
verses.translation: By harboring this knowledge, the living being acquires my wearing nature. Then he is no longer born at the time of creation and does not suffer at the time of destruction.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Mam yonirmahad brahma tasmin garbhang dadhamyaham.
Possible: Sarbhuthanang tato Bhavati Bharat
verses.translation: O India! Brahman, the essence of nature, is my yonisvarupa and in that Brahman I impregnate, resulting in the birth of all living beings.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Sarvajonishu Kaunteya Murtaya: Vishakanti Jah
Tasang Brahma Mahad Jonirhang Bijaprada: Father..4..
verses.translation: O Kaunteya! All the images that manifest in all yonis, Brahmarupi yoni is their mother-form and I am the seed-giving father.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Sattwang Rajastam Iti Guna Prakritisambhava.
Nivdhnanti Mahabaho Dehe Dehinamvyam..5..
verses.translation: O Mahabaho! The three qualities of Jata sattva, raja and tama from the material nature bind the avaya jiva located within this body.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Tatra Sattwang Nirmalvat Prakashmanamayam.
Sukhsangen Badhnati Gnansangen Changh..6..
verses.translation: O innocent! Among these three qualities, the Sattva quality, being pure, binds the living being with the manifestation and sinlessness and the association of happiness and wisdom.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Rajo ragattang vidhi trishnasangasamudhavvam.
7.
verses.translation: O Kaunteya! The Rajoguna is passionate and will know that it arises from craving and attachment and it is the Rajoguna that binds the Jiva to the addiction of Sakam Karma.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Tamastvajnjang vidhi mohanang sarvadehinam.
Pramadalsyanidravistannibadhnati India
verses.translation: O India! The ignorant will know Tamoguna as the charmer of all beings. That tamoguna binds the living being by ecstasy, laziness and sleep.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Satvang Sukhe Sanjayati Raj: Karmani Bharat.
Jnanamavrtya tu tamah pramade sanjayatyut..9..
verses.translation: O India! Sattva guna binds the living being to happiness, Rajo guna binds the living being to sakam karma and tamoguna binds the living being to pramad.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
India is located east of Rajasthan.
10.
verses.translation: O India! By overcoming Raja and Tamoguna, Sattva becomes stronger, by overcoming Sattva and Tamoguna, Rajoguna becomes stronger, and in the same way, by overcoming Sattva and Rajoguna, Tamoguna becomes stronger.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Sarvadvareshu Dehhasmin Prakash Upajayat.
Gnanang yada tada vidyad vividdhang sattvamityut..11..
verses.translation: When knowledge manifests in all the gates of this body, then sattguna will be known to have increased.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Greed: Pravrttirarambha: Karnamamsam: Spriha.
Rajsetani Jayante Vivridde Bharatharshava..12..
verses.translation: O Bharatashreshta! If Rajoguna is increased, greed, instinct, zeal for action and irrepressible passion increase.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Aprakashohpravrttich pramado moha et f.
Tamsyetani Jayante Vivridde Kurunandan.
verses.translation: O Kurunandan! When tamoguna is increased, ignorance-darkness, passivity, ecstasy and infatuation arise.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
When sattvae provredde tu pralayang jati dehbhrut.
14.
verses.translation: When the bodied jiva leaves the body at the time of increasing sattguna, he attains the pure superior people of the Maharshi.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Rajasi Pralayang Gatva Karmasangyeshu Zayate.
15.
verses.translation: If you die in Rajoguna, you will be born in a karma-addicted human family, similarly if you die in Tamoguna, you will be born in the womb of an animal.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Karman: Sukritsyahu: Satvikang Nirmalang Phalam.
16.
verses.translation: Sukriti-ful sattika karma results in nirmala, rajasic karma results in misery and tamasic karma results in ajna or unconsciousness.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Sattva Sanjayate Gnanang Rajaso Love and f.
17
verses.translation: Knowledge arises from Sattva, greed from Rajoguna and ignorance, delusion and delusion from Tamoguna.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Tishthanti Rajasah in upper Gachchanti Satvastha.
18.
verses.translation: Those with sattva qualities ascend to the higher realms, those with raja gunas reside in the mundane world, and tamasic persons with vile qualities degenerate and live in hell.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Nanyang Gunevya: Kartarang Jada Drshtanaupsyati.
Gunevyashcha parang betti madbhabang sodhigachti..19..
verses.translation: When the living being sees that there is no other doer in action except the qualities of nature and knows that the Supreme Lord is beyond all these qualities, then he attains my prakriti.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Gunanetanatitya Trin Dehi Dehsamudvavan.
Born and died in death. 20.
verses.translation: Being freed from these three qualities of birth, death, decay and suffering, the living being with a body enjoys amrita.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Arjun Ubach
Curling women gunanetanatito bhavati pravo.
Kimachara: Kathang Chaitangastrin gunanativarta..21..
verses.translation: Arjuna asked - O Lord! He who is past these three qualities, he is known by what signs? What is his behavior? And how does he overcome these threefold?.
verses.speaker: Arjuna

verses.Language:
Prakasang f Pravting f Mohameb f Pandav.
22.
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said - O Pandavas! He who does not hate when manifestations, passions and delusions arise, and does not desire even when they are restrained;
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Udasinavadasino gunayiryo na vichalyate.
23.
verses.translation: He who, being situated as indifferent, is not disturbed by the qualities, but the qualities are engaged in their own action, thus knowingly stands and is not disturbed by them;
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Samadukhsukh: Swastha: Samaloshtashamkanchan:
24.
verses.translation: He who is self-settled and equal in happiness and sorrow; He who is like-minded in clay, stone and gold; He who is equal in love and dislike; One who is patient and equal-minded in condemnation, praise, honor and insult;
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Manapamanyostulyastulyo Mitraripaksyo:
25.
verses.translation: He who is equanimous towards both enemies and friends and who renounces all karmas - he is said to be Gunatit.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Mang cha yohvyavicharen bhaktiyogen sevate.
Sa Gunan Samatityaitan Brahmabhuaya Kalpte..26..
verses.translation: One who serves Me with absolute devotion transcends all qualities of nature and rises to the stage of Brahmabhuta.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

verses.Language:
Brahmano hi Stahhamamritsyavyayasya f.
Sasvatsya f Dharmasya Suksyaikantikasya f..27..
verses.translation: I am the establishment or refuge of the independent Brahman. I am the shelter of eternal nectar, eternal religion and eternal bliss.
verses.speaker: Shri Bhagwan

summary.title: Chapter Fourteen - Gunatraya-Vibhagayoga
summary.description: Gunatraya-Vibhagayoga is taught in this chapter. Lord Krishna has described the nature and effects of the three gunas sattva, raja and tama. He explained that liberation can be achieved by transcending these qualities.
keyThemes: Characteristics of Sattva, Raja and Tama
